title: Absorption of light through interstellar gases

content.question: An absorption spectrum, observed for light traveling through interstellar gases, appears as a broad spectrum of light with isolated dark lines at frequencies characteristic of the molecules in the gases. Which of the following is primarily responsible for the location of the dark absorption lines in the spectrum?

choices.label: The characteristic velocities of the molecules in the gas
The transition of electrons between discrete energy states within the gas molecules
The percent of the gas molecules that were ionized by absorption of energy
The fluctuations in density of molecules present in the interstellar gas cloud

content.answer: The transition of electrons between discrete energy states within the gas molecules

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
